description: After the installation of security updates KB5040442, KB5040431, and KB5040427 released on July 9, 2024, systems may exhibit a potential for secure boot feature bypass. This presents significant risks where an attacker could exploit this vulnerability if they have physical access or limited administrative privileges. Users might notice increased warnings about system integrity or receive notifications regarding policy changes from the secure boot feature. System administrators should remain vigilant as the unauthorized modification to security settings could allow malware to evade detection. This is particularly crucial for Windows 10 and 11 environments, as the vulnerability affects build numbers 10.0.25398.1009 and lower. Continual monitoring and immediate remediation actions are recommended for affected systems, ensuring that integrity remains intact post-update.
